title: The Hatchling’s Cold Welcome
summary: On the day the ducklings hatch, the brood mother and her children notice that one hatchling looks and smells different—an omega among betas and alphas. The brood mother debates whether to accept or reject the odd duckling; the alpha duckling, motivated by pride and tradition, bullies the newcomer and rallies the siblings to shun him. The mother ultimately allows the ugly duckling to stay but warns him to keep out of sight, setting up a tense family dynamic.

title: Driven from the Pond
summary: After a confrontation where the ugly duckling accidentally ruins the alpha duckling’s nest, the alpha leads the siblings in mocking him. The mother refuses to defend the ugly duckling, fearing the alpha’s wrath and the loss of her status. Hurt and humiliated, the ugly duckling decides to leave the pond, running away into the marshlands to find a place where he belongs.

title: A Pack of Strangers
summary: Wandering alone, the ugly duckling encounters a group of wild geese who challenge his presence and attempt to establish dominance. He tries to ingratiate himself by offering to help gather food, but the geese dismiss him as an outsider omega. When hunters arrive and open fire, the geese take flight and abandon the ugly duckling, who narrowly escapes by hiding in the reeds.

title: Shelter with the Old Cat
summary: Desperate for shelter, the ugly duckling stumbles into a barn where an old cat (an alpha) and a hen (a beta) reside. The cat interrogates the duckling, demanding he prove his worth by catching mice, which he fails. The hen suggests he try to lay eggs, but when he can’t, they banish him from the barn, each motivated by maintaining their own hierarchy and superiority.

title: Winter’s Cruel Test
summary: As winter sets in, the ugly duckling struggles to survive, scavenging for food and evading predators. He is caught in a trap set by a farmer, who brings him home to be fattened for a meal. The farmer’s child, seeing the duckling’s distress, secretly frees him. The duckling flees into the snow, his survival owed to the child’s empathy and decision to disobey her parent.

title: Spring’s New Reflection
summary: With the arrival of spring, the ugly duckling stumbles upon a lake where a flock of swans (true alphas) land. Driven by exhaustion and resignation, he approaches them, prepared for rejection. Instead, the swans welcome him and, seeing his reflection, he realizes he has transformed into a beautiful swan—an alpha among alphas. The swans invite him to join their ranks, fulfilling his longing for acceptance and belonging.
